data.title: Aaron Ramsey named as new Wales captain after Gareth Bale retirement
data.meta_description:
Aaron Ramsey has been named as the new captain of the Wales national team after Gareth Bale’s retirement two months ago.

However, Wales manager Rob Page confirmed earlier today that Ramsey will succeed Bale as captain going forward.

data.text:
Aaron Ramsey has been named as the new captain of the Wales national team after Gareth Bale’s retirement two months ago.

Bale, who announced his retirement from the game in January, first captained the side in 2018 taking over from Ashley Williams.

However, Wales manager Rob Page confirmed earlier today that Ramsey will succeed Bale as captain going forward.

Ben Davies, another senior member of the Wales side who made his international debut 11 years ago, has been named vice-captain.

Ramsey, 32, made his international debut 15 years ago, starting against Denmark in November 2008 in a team that featured Bale, Williams, Chris Gunter, and Craig Bellamy.

The former Arsenal and Juventus midfielder has gone on to make 78 international appearances, scoring 20 goals and providing nine assists.

As well as losing Bale, Joe Allen also announced his retirement from international football last month bringing to an end a 14-year international career that garnered 74 caps.

Page also selected the uncapped quartet of Oli Cooper, Jordan James, Nathan Broadhead, and Luke Harris in a new-look Wales side.

After being drawn into a qualifying group with Croatia, Latvia, Turkey, and Armenia, Wales are next in action against Croatia in a European qualifier on March 25.

GO DEEPER

Bale's retirement is the end of a Wales era - his story will be told for generations

(Photo: Getty Images)
